cab.content: 191/'Yom Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India, Uth May 1919.(Received 14th at 10 p.m.)6498. Daily report. On 11th May', at Landi Kotal, portion of 1st Division attacked the Afghans, whose main strength was about Khargali. We occupied this village and neighbouring heights covering Bagh and Tangi springs. Aeroplanes report number of enemy retiring towards Dakka. Captures include three guns and two horse teams. Casualties reported slight. Casualties reported up to and including 10th May : three Indian ranks killed, two British and 11 Indian ranks wounded.
